title: Debugging an existing Python script for Linux (Datacollecting)
snippet:
Datacollectingpy which collects the different raw data xlsx files from the scraping scripts and aggregates them into 1 xlsx file. References a config file. 
The previous version works in Windows environment, but i) py script was v sensitive to 'corrupt' files and skips xlsx sheets when that happens.
Datacollectingpy - 
a) allow easy (future) re-configuration of sheet 'ordering' ie how sheets are ordered (rather than hardcoded) ie order of the sheets in xlsx...which is first, second, third
b) Raw xlsx files are distributed into different folders (as explained in picture previously). So to allow the py script to work regardless of absence/relocation of data folder/files. and to output into different files, according to the distributed folder structure (due to different scraping frequencies/content grouping).
To be triggered via jenkins scheduling, at the end of each scraping sub-list
